task.summary: - Added a separate eval grammar terminal and method parseEvalExpr to parse command and variable substitutions in strings. - Disabled automatic printing of command result when executing lines from a script. - Hardened commands in the commands module. - Added new unishell banner
- Moved the execute method to the unishell.py file
- Moved the execute method to the unishell.py file

- Fixed bug in commands module (Changed String to str) - Since the entire file is being parsed at once. A single syntax error on any line will abort execution of the script. Commented the line with the syntax error. - Command output is not being echoed by default in scripts. It will still be echoed with the -c option and from within the REPL.
- Removed the ExecutionContext and Variable classes
- Adding commands setopt, options - Adding prologue.py - Adding formatters.py

- The autoprint option will now be set to true by default. The set commands will now return None and the echo command will return the message without printing it to reduce excessively verbose output. The cd command will return None when changing directory. It will return the current directory when invoked without any arguments. - Deleted the setopt command the user must now use pushopt instead. Renamed getopt to peekopt to avoid confusion with the unix getopt function. - Adding options.ush - Removed unnecessary (=all :)) commands from the prologue - Modified the execute method to honor the autoprint option and the syntax check flag.

- The autoprint option will now be set to true by default. The set commands will now return None and the echo command will return the message without printing it to reduce excessively verbose output. The cd command will return None when changing directory. It will return the current directory when invoked without any arguments. - Deleted the setopt command the user must now use pushopt instead. Renamed getopt to peekopt to avoid confusion with the unix getopt function. - Adding options.ush - Removed unnecessary (=all :)) commands from the prologue - Modified the execute method to honor the autoprint option and the syntax check flag.
Moved interpreter.py to interpreter/__init__.py. Moved some ASG nodes to the interpreter/ASG folder.
Created a formatters module from existing files.
Created a pipeline module from existing files.
Created a pipeline module from existing files.
Moved some files to the pipeline.objects package.
If the reference file for a test does not exist the current output will be copied to the reference_output folder.

MESSAGE.value: - Added a separate eval grammar terminal and method parseEvalExpr to parse command and variable substitutions in strings. - Disabled automatic printing of command result when executing lines from a script. - Hardened commands in the commands module. - Added new unishell banner
- Moved the execute method to the unishell.py file

- Fixed bug in commands module (Changed String to str) - Since the entire file is being parsed at once. A single syntax error on any line will abort execution of the script. Commented the line with the syntax error. - Command output is not being echoed by default in scripts. It will still be echoed with the -c option and from within the REPL.
- Removed the ExecutionContext and Variable classes
- Adding commands setopt, options - Adding prologue.py - Adding formatters.py

- The autoprint option will now be set to true by default. The set commands will now return None and the echo command will return the message without printing it to reduce excessively verbose output. The cd command will return None when changing directory. It will return the current directory when invoked without any arguments. - Deleted the setopt command the user must now use pushopt instead. Renamed getopt to peekopt to avoid confusion with the unix getopt function. - Adding options.ush - Removed unnecessary (=all :)) commands from the prologue - Modified the execute method to honor the autoprint option and the syntax check flag.
Moved interpreter.py to interpreter/__init__.py. Moved some ASG nodes to the interpreter/ASG folder.

Created a pipeline module from existing files.

If the reference file for a test does not exist the current output will be copied to the reference_output folder.
